summary.name: Fairphone Supply Chain
summary.description:
Supply chains for the Fairphone, comparing the Fairphone 2, 3, and 4. Data provided by Fairphone.

"To gain a deeper understanding of the complex, often opaque consumer electronics supply chain, we’re mapping all the different materials, suppliers and manufacturing locations involved in creating our phone. In addition to our first-tier assembly manufacturer, we have now mapped all second-tier component suppliers, and are progressively researching third and fourth-tier suppliers. Besides increasing transparency, we’re using this information to engage with individual suppliers, establish relationships and pioneer innovative solutions in our impact areas…" Fairphone Supply Chain Engagement Report 2024

overview.name: GSN
overview.description: Connector manufacturer GSN has been working to integrate social impact into their business. In early 2013, as the company was begin a partnership that could both advance GSN’s transformation road map and support Fairphone’s value proposition.

overview.name: AIM
overview.description: For the Fairphone 2, we continue to work with Scaling Up the Mineral Trade and Solutions for Hope to source conflict-free tin. AIM Solder is a manufacturer of tin-lead solder assembly materials for the electronics industry. Their production line includes the solder paste present in the Fairphone 2.

overview.name: AVX
overview.description: AVX is a manufacturer and supplier of passive electronic components of the Fairphone 2. They source the tantalum through smelters that are processing ore from the conflict-free tantalum initiatives that we support.

overview.name: Sociedad de Trabajadores Mineros S.A. (SOTRAMI)
overview.description:
Minera Sotrami S.A. (Sociedad de Trabajadores Mineros S.A.) in Peru has 164 shareholders and employs 260 mineworkers as well as five engineers who manage the mine and processing plant.

The gold mined here meets the Fairtrade Standard for Gold and Precious Metals.

overview.name: AT&S
overview.description: With a very advanced view on sustainability, AT&S, our printed circuit board (PCB) manufacturer, was keen to join forces to explore the possibility of connecting Fairtrade certified gold to their supply chain. A smartphone contains about 30mg of gold, 6-9mg of which is found on the PCB of the Fairphone 2.
